file_content.text: Squad, hold up! Get me a solid perimeter, ASAP!
You must be the commander of Havoc Squad. I'm Lieutenant Tasser, sir--Forty-third Advance Recon Squad.
What can I do for you, Lieutenant?
Good to meet you.
If you came to help, you're a little late.
You supposed to be my backup?
Yes, sir, that's definitely the impression we got coming in. Apologies.
This is a Havoc op, Tasser--and I have everything well in hand.
Get lost.
Yes, sir, I can see that.
General Garza rerouted us from a two-week sightseeing op on Ryloth to assist you, Lieutenant. Looks like you've already taken care of things, though.
The mission was a complete success.
That's affirmative, Lieutenant.
If I'd known reinforcements were inbound, I would've waited.
Sorry you came for nothing.
Well, it doesn't look like you needed us to begin with.
Feel free to look around, you might learn something.
This is how the pros do it.
Yeah, my men and I are learning valuable lessons even as we speak.
Garza mentioned a possible prisoner for us to haul back to Coruscant.
Is this the guy Garza was talking about?
Take this man to Coruscant immediately.
Yes, he is.
Understood, Lieutenant.
Treat him well, Lieutenant--he's a valued ally.
This man is a friend.
Are you... do you mean that, Lieutenant? Wow, I, uh... thanks.
I guess I'll, uh, I'll see you around, then. Good luck.
Good luck to you too, Fuse.
Thanks.
I'm glad you chose the right side in the end, Fuse.
It's good to have you back.
Thanks, Lieutenant. So am I.
Go on, get out of here.
You'd better get moving.
I want this traitor out of my sight.
Get him out of here.
Yes, sir. Right away.
Uh... goodbye, then, Lieutenant.
All right, people, let's move out! I want a full sweep through this facility for intel.
Good meeting you, Lieutenant. Maybe we'll see you around later.
Let's go, people!
So, did you find the guy, or what? If he's still running loose, we could lend you a hand.
The objective could not be taken alive.
No need.
Can't win 'em all, I guess.
You should find the target's body inside.
I already took care of him.
Take no prisoners, huh? Roger that.
The objective didn't play along with the Imps, so the they took him out.
The Imperials killed him.
I, uh, I won't ask, Lieutenant.
All right, people, let's sweep through the rubble and see if we can find the target's body to take back to General Garza.
See you around, sir.
I'll, uh, I'll just stay here where you can see me, Lieutenant.
You... you were serious. You let that monster escape, just... just so you could kill me yourself.
Well, you--you obviously enjoy senseless killing. A lot of innocent people will die now that Gorik has gotten away with those designs.
Successful missions always come with a price.
I'm just doing my job.
And you're glad to pay, so long as it's other people's lives, other people's families, right?
Killing is the whole reason I signed up.
Yes, actually, I do enjoy it.
You're insane.
I've reconsidered--you're more useful alive.
I'm not going to kill you.
Hey, Lieutenant, I, uh, I guess I should thank you. You saved my life, after everything.
You're welcome.
Well, I'm still not so sure it was the right thing to do, but, uh... thanks.
I stopped the explosion so I could bring you in alive, nothing more.
Don't take it personally.
Just business, huh? Well, thanks anyway.
Still, it's... well, it's hard, knowing my designs might be hurting innocent people. I helped Gorik--helped a monster. It's unforgivable.
That monster is going to face justice.
We'll get Gorik, don't worry.
I hope so. Before... well, before anyone else gets hurt.
What you've done may be unforgivable, but you can still be useful.
Time to make it up to us.
"Useful." I guess that's something.
You're not going to whine the whole way out of here, are you?
I don't want to hear it.
Sorry, Lieutenant. It's just... it's a lot to take in, you know?
Okay then, let's, uh, go. Consider me officially surrendered, Lieutenant. I'll stay where you can see me.
It's a long trip back to Coruscant.
Let's move out.
I'm ready, Lieutenant.
I'm pretty sure we're on the same team.
That's alright, I trust you.
It's... it's good to be back. Thanks.
No sudden moves, got it?
Start walking, prisoner.
Uh, understood, Lieutenant.
You're too dangerous to keep alive, Fuse.
And now, I'm going to end it.
You... you what? You let that monster escape... just so you could kill me yourself?
So many innocent people... you're insane.
Go ahead then, Lieutenant. Get it over with.
Goodbye, Fuse.
All right.
Nice knowing you, Fuse.
It's been fun.
This is for Ord Mantell, scum.
Death to all traitors!
Just do it.
Forget about me, Lieutenant! Stop Gorik! Please!
Lieutenant! You made it just in time--Gorik called for a full-scale evacuation.
He's already at the hangar in the back of the base, overseeing the evacuation--and he has my bomb designs with him.
Please, you have to get to the landing area and stop Gorik before he escapes with my bomb designs!
Gorik won't escape from me.
Understood.
If anyone can do it, it's you. Good luck, Lieu--
Am I just supposed to leave you here?
What about you?
You're the reason I'm here, Fuse. Not Gorik.
Gorik isn't my objective.
I'm, uh, I'm clearly not going anywhere, Lieutenant. After you've taken down Gorik, you can--
Warning! Warning! Self-destruct sequence initialized! All personnel must evacuate to the hangar area immediately! This is not a drill!
Countdown sequence initialized. Warning! Warning! Facility detonation imminent!
Oh, no. We're too late. The entire base, it--it's going to be vaporized, we... we're out of time.
There must be some way to shut down the self-destruct sequence.
How do I stop it?
Don't give up on me now. We're getting out of here.
This isn't over yet, Fuse.
Heh. Havoc Squad never surrenders, right? Never fails.
Are you telling me there's no way out?
So, what, we're dead meat?
No, I... I'm not saying that. I mean, you can cancel the self-destruct sequence.
You... you'd have to go to the command center to cancel the detonation. Y--you could even unlock my cell from there.
But... by the time you reach the command center and stop the explosion, Gorik will have escaped with my bomb designs--that can't happen.
I'm sure I can stop the explosion and get Gorik if I move fast enough.
So I'll double-time it.
No, you... you have to leave me. By the time you cancel the self-destruct, Gorik will be long gone.
Please, there isn't time to argue. It's down to me or the bomb designs, and... well, there's only one good choice there.
Gorik can't be allowed to escape with those bomb designs.
You're right.
I've made my choice, and I'm getting you out of here.
I don't leave people behind.
I don't care about Gorik or the designs. I was sent here for you.
My orders are to capture you.
Forget about me! Stop Gorik, keep the Empire from getting my designs, that's all that matters.
Today isn't your day to die, Fuse.
I'm getting you out of here.
We'll track down that Imp scum before he gets too far.
Gorik won't escape for long.
You can't know that for sure. And how many people might die in the meantime?
I've made my decision.
Stop arguing.
Please, Lieutenant. Don't let Gorik escape just for me. Please, don't do it.
Stopping Gorik serves the greater good.
You're right.
You, uh, you should hurry. We've spent too much time talking already.
The hangar is at the other end of the base. Good luck, Lieutenant.
And, uh, please... please tell General Garza I'm sorry I let her down.
I'll be sure Garza knows what you did here. It's been an honor serving with you, Fuse.
I will.
You, too, Lieutenant.
Nice knowing you.
Goodbye, Fuse.
So long.
I hope you enjoy your execution.
Have fun dying, traitor.
Just go, Lieutenant. Just go.
If I'd been sent to eliminate Gorik, I would. But I was sent to eliminate you.
I'm here to kill you, not him.
The, uh... the explosion should take care of that. But Gorik--think about how many innocent people he'll kill with those designs.
I don't care what happens to me, Lieutenant. Just please, stop Gorik.
I'll stop Gorik before he escapes.
Fine.
Please, Lieutenant... hurry.
Sorry, but if I don't kill you myself, I can't know for sure.
I have to confirm the kill.
I'll be back to kill you in no time.
Just wait right here.
Don't let that monster escape. Please.
Save it, traitor.
So long, traitor.
You don't sound very happy.
